also many provision and thus be our circumstance at this period of time . alma and the lamanites be sallying forth against u from time to time resolve by stratagem to destroy u nevertheless we could not come to battle with them because of their retreat and their stronghold . alma and it come to pass that we do wait in these difficult circumstance for the space of many month even until we be about to perish for the want of food . alma but it come to pass that we do receive food which be guard to u by an army of two thousand men to our assistance and this be all the assistance which we do receive to defend ourselves and our country from fall into the hand of our enemy yea to contend with an enemy which be innumerable . alma and now the cause of these our embarrassment or the cause why they do not send more strength unto u we know not therefore we be grieve and also fill with fear lest by any mean the judgment of god should come upon our land to our overthrow and utter destruction . alma therefore we do pour out our soul in prayer to god that he would strengthen u and deliver u out of the hand of our enemy yea and also give u strength that we might retain our city and our land and our possession for the support of our people . alma yea and it come to pass that the lord our god do visit u with assurance that he would deliver u yea insomuch that he do speak peace to our soul and do grant unto u great faith and do cause u that we should hope for our deliverance in him . alma and we do take courage with our small force which we have receive and be fix with a determination to conquer our enemy and to maintain our land and our possession and our wife and our child and the cause of our liberty . alma and thus we do go forth with all our might against the lamanites who be in the city of manti and we do pitch our tent by the wilderness side which be near to the city . alma and it come to pass that on the morrow that when the lamanites saw that we be in the border by the wilderness which be near the city that they send out their spy round about u that they might discover the number and the strength of our army . alma and it come to pass that when they saw that we be not strong accord to our number and fear that we should cut them off from their support except they should come out to battle against u and kill u and also suppose that they could easily destroy u with their numerous host therefore they begin to make preparation to come out against u to battle . alma and when we saw that they be make preparation to come out against u behold i cause that gid with a small number of men should secrete himself in the wilderness and also that teomner and a small number of men should secrete themselves also in the wilderness . alma now gid and his men be on the right and the others on the left and when they have thus secrete themselves behold i remain with the remainder of my army in that same place where we have first pitch our tent against the time that the lamanites should come out to battle . alma and it come to pass that the lamanites do come out with their numerous army against u . and when they have come and be about to fall upon u with the sword i cause that my men those who be with me should retreat into the wilderness . alma and it come to pass that the lamanites do follow after u with great speed for they be exceedingly desirous to overtake u that they might slay u therefore they do follow u into the wilderness and we do pas by in the midst of gid and teomner insomuch that they be not discover by the lamanites . alma and it come to pass that when the lamanites have pass by or when the army have pass by gid and teomner do rise up from their secret place and do cut off the spy of the lamanites that they should not return to the city . alma and it come to pass that when they have cut them off they run to the city and fell upon the guard who be leave to guard the city insomuch that they do destroy them and do take possession of the city . alma now this be do because the lamanites do suffer their whole army save a few guard only to be lead away into the wilderness . alma and it come to pass that gid and teomner by this mean have obtain possession of their stronghold . and it come to pass that we take our course after have travel much in the wilderness towards the land of zarahemla . alma and when the lamanites saw that they be march towards the land of zarahemla they be exceedingly afraid l there be a plan lay to lead them on to destruction therefore they begin to retreat into the wilderness again yea even back by the same way which they have come . alma and behold it be night and they do pitch their tent for the chief captain of the lamanites have suppose that the nephites be weary because of their march and suppose that they have drive their whole army therefore they take no thought concern the city of manti . alma now it come to pass that when it be night i cause that my men should not sleep but that they should march forward by another way towards the land of manti . alma and because of this our march in the night time behold on the morrow we be beyond the lamanites insomuch that we do arrive before them at the city of manti . alma and thus it come to pass that by this stratagem we do take possession of the city of manti without the shedding of blood . alma and it come to pass that when the army of the lamanites do arrive near the city and saw that we be prepare to meet them they be astonish exceedingly and struck with great fear insomuch that they do flee into the wilderness . alma yea and it come to pass that the army of the lamanites do flee out of all this quarter of the land . but behold they have carry with them many woman and child out of the land . alma and those city which have be take by the lamanites all of them be at this period of time in our possession and our father and our woman and our child be return to their home all save it be those who have be take prisoner and carry off by the lamanites . alma but behold our army be small to maintain so great a number of city and so great possession . alma but behold we trust in our god who have give u victory over those land insomuch that we have obtain those city and those land which be our own . alma now we do not know the cause that the government do not grant u more strength neither do those men who come up unto u know why we have not receive great strength . alma behold we do not know but what ye be unsuccessful and ye have draw away the force into that quarter of the land if so we do not desire to murmur . alma and if it be not so behold we fear that there be some faction in the government that they do not send more men to our assistance for we know that they be more numerous than that which they have send . alma but behold it mattereth not we trust god will deliver u notwithstanding the weakness of our army yea and deliver u out of the hand of our enemy . alma behold this be the twenty and ninth year in the latter end and we be in the possession of our land and the lamanites have flee to the land of nephi . alma and those son of the people of ammon of whom i have so highly speak be with me in the city of manti and the lord have support them yea and keep them from fall by the sword insomuch that even one soul have not be slay . alma but behold they have receive many wound nevertheless they stand fast in that liberty wherewith god have make them free and they be strict to remember the lord their god from day to day yea they do observe to keep his statute and his judgment and his commandment continually and their faith be strong in the prophecy concern that which be to come . alma and now my beloved brother moroni may the lord our god who have redeem u and make u free keep you continually in his presence yea and may he favor this people even that ye may have success in obtain the possession of all that which the lamanites have take from u which be for our support . and now behold i close mine epistle . i be helaman the son of alma . alma chapter alma now it come to pass in the thirtieth year of the reign of the judge over the people of nephi after moroni have receive and have read helaman 's epistle he be exceedingly rejoiced because of the welfare yea the exceed success which helaman have have in obtain those land which be lose . alma yea and he do make it know unto all his people in all the land round about in that part where he be that they might rejoice also . alma and it come to pass that he immediately send an epistle to pahoran desire that he should cause men to be gather together to strengthen helaman or the army of helaman insomuch that he might with ease maintain that part of the land which he have be so miraculously prosper in regain . alma and it come to pass when moroni have send this epistle to the land of zarahemla he begin again to lay a plan that he might obtain the remainder of those possession and city which the lamanites have take from them . alma and it come to pass that while moroni be thus make preparation to go against the lamanites to battle behold the people of nephihah who be gather together from the city of moroni and the city of lehi and the city of morianton be attack by the lamanites . alma yea even those who have be compel to flee from the land of manti and from the land round about have come over and join the lamanites in this part of the land . alma and thus be exceedingly numerous yea and receive strength from day to day by the command of ammoron they come forth against the people of nephihah and they do begin to slay them with an exceedingly great slaughter . alma and their army be so numerous that the remainder of the people of nephihah be oblige to flee before them and they come even and join the army of moroni . alma and now a moroni have suppose that there should be men send to the city nephihah to the assistance of the people to maintain that city and know that it be easy to keep the city from fall into the hand of the lamanites than to retake it from them he suppose that they would easily maintain that city . alma therefore he retain all his force to maintain those place which he have recover . alma and now when moroni saw that the city of nephihah be lose he be exceedingly sorrowful and begin to doubt because of the wickedness of the people whether they should not fall into the hand of their brother . alma now this be the case with all his chief captain . they doubt and marvel also because of the wickedness of the people and this because of the success of the lamanites over them . alma and it come to pass that moroni be angry with the government because of their indifference concern the freedom of their country . alma chapter alma and it come to pass that he write again to the governor of the land who be pahoran and these be the word which he write say behold i direct mine epistle to pahoran in the city of zarahemla who be the chief judge and the governor over the land and also to all those who have be choose by this people to govern and manage the affair of this war . alma for behold i have somewhat to say unto them by the way of condemnation for behold ye yourselves know that ye have be appoint to gather together men and arm them with sword and with cimeters and all manner of weapon of war of every kind and send forth against the lamanites in whatsoever part they should come into our land . alma and now behold i say unto you that myself and also my men and also helaman and his men have suffer exceedingly great suffering yea even hunger thirst and fatigue and all manner of affliction of every kind . alma but behold be this all we have suffer we would not murmur nor complain . alma but behold great have be the slaughter among our people yea thousand have fall by the sword while it might have otherwise be if ye have render unto our army sufficient strength and succor for them . yea great have be your neglect towards u . alma and now behold we desire to know the cause of this exceedingly great neglect yea we desire to know the cause of your thoughtless state . alma can you think to sit upon your throne in a state of thoughtless stupor while your enemy be spread the work of death around you ? yea while they be murder thousand of your brother alma yea even they who have look up to you for protection yea have place you in a situation that ye might have succor them yea ye might have send army unto them to have strengthen them and have save thousand of them from fall by the sword . alma but behold this be not all ye have withhold your provision from them insomuch that many have fight and bleed out their life because of their great desire which they have for the welfare of this people yea and this they have do when they be about to perish with hunger because of your exceedingly great neglect towards them . alma and now my beloved brother for ye ought to be beloved yea and ye ought to have stir yourselves more diligently for the welfare and the freedom of this people but behold ye have neglect them insomuch that the blood of thousand shall come upon your head for vengeance yea for know unto god be all their cry and all their suffering alma behold could ye suppose that ye could sit upon your throne and because of the exceed goodness of god ye could do nothing and he would deliver you ? behold if ye have suppose this ye have suppose in vain . alma do ye suppose that because so many of your brother have be kill it be because of their wickedness ? i say unto you if ye have suppose this ye have suppose in vain for i say unto you there be many who have fall by the sword and behold it be to your condemnation alma for the lord suffereth the righteous to be slay that his justice and judgment may come upon the wicked therefore ye need not suppose that the righteous be lose because they be slain but behold they do enter into the rest of the lord their god . alma and now behold i say unto you i fear exceedingly that the judgment of god will come upon this people because of their exceeding slothfulness yea even the slothfulness of our government and their exceedingly great neglect towards their brother yea towards those who have be slay . alma for be it not for the wickedness which first commence at our head we could have withstand our enemy that they could have gain no power over u . alma yea have it not be for the war which break out among ourselves yea be it not for these king men who cause so much bloodshed among ourselves yea at the time we be contend among ourselves if we have unite our strength a we hitherto have do yea have it not be for the desire of power and authority which those king men have over u have they be true to the cause of our freedom and united with u and go forth against our enemy instead of take up their sword against u which be the cause of so much bloodshed among ourselves yea if we have go forth against them in the strength of the lord we should have disperse our enemy for it would have be do accord to the fulfilling of his word . alma but behold now the lamanites be come upon u take possession of our land and they be murder our people with the sword yea our woman and our child and also carry them away captive cause them that they should suffer all manner of affliction and this because of the great wickedness of those who be seek for power and authority yea even those king men . alma but why should i say much concerning this matter ? for we know not but what ye yourselves be seek for authority . we know not but what ye be also traitor to your country . alma or be it that ye have neglect u because ye be in the heart of our country and ye be surround by security that ye do not cause food to be send unto u and also men to strengthen our army ? alma have ye forget the commandment of the lord your god ? yea have ye forget the captivity of our father ? have ye forget the many time we have be deliver out of the hand of our enemy ? alma or do ye suppose that the lord will still deliver u while we sit upon our throne and do not make use of the mean which the lord have provide for u ? alma yea will ye sit in idleness while ye be surround with thousand of those yea and ten of thousand who do also sit in idleness while there be thousand round about in the border of the land who be fall by the sword yea wound and bleed ? alma do ye suppose that god will look upon you a guiltless while ye sit still and behold these thing ? behold i say unto you nay . now i would that ye should remember that god have say that the inward vessel shall be cleanse first and then shall the out vessel be cleanse also . alma and now except ye do repent of that which ye have do and begin to be up and do and send forth food and men unto u and also unto helaman that he may support those part of our country which he have regain and that we may also recover the remainder of our possession in these part behold it will be expedient that we contend no more with the lamanites until we have first cleanse our inward vessel yea even the great head of our government . alma and except ye grant mine epistle and come out and show unto me a true spirit of freedom and strive to strengthen and fortify our army and grant unto them food for their support behold i will leave a part of my freeman to maintain this part of our land and i will leave the strength and the blessing of god upon them that none other power can operate against them alma and this because of their exceeding faith and their patience in their tribulation alma and i will come unto you and if there be any among you that have a desire for freedom yea if there be even a spark of freedom remain behold i will stir up insurrection among you even until those who have desire to usurp power and authority shall become extinct . alma yea behold i do not fear your power nor your authority but it be my god whom i fear and it be accord to his commandment that i do take my sword to defend the cause of my country and it be because of your iniquity that we have suffer so much loss . alma behold it be time yea the time be now at hand that except ye do bestir yourselves in the defence of your country and your little one the sword of justice doth hang over you yea and it shall fall upon you and visit you even to your utter destruction . alma behold i wait for assistance from you and except ye do administer unto our relief behold i come unto you even in the land of zarahemla and smite you with the sword insomuch that ye can have no more power to impede the progress of this people in the cause of our freedom . alma for behold the lord will not suffer that ye shall live and wax strong in your iniquity to destroy his righteous people . alma behold can you suppose that the lord will spare you and come out in judgment against the lamanites when it be the tradition of their father that have cause their hatred yea and it have be redouble by those who have dissent from u while your iniquity be for the cause of your love of glory and the vain thing of the world ? alma ye know that ye do transgress the law of god and ye do know that ye do trample them under your foot . behold the lord saith unto me if those whom ye have appoint your governor do not repent of their sin and iniquity ye shall go up to battle against them . alma and now behold i moroni be constrain accord to the covenant which i have make to keep the commandment of my god therefore i would that ye should adhere to the word of god and send speedily unto me of your provision and of your men and also to helaman . alma and behold if ye will not do this i come unto you speedily for behold god will not suffer that we should perish with hunger therefore he will give unto u of your food even if it must be by the sword . now see that ye fulfil the word of god . alma behold i be moroni your chief captain . i seek not for power but to pull it down . i seek not for honor of the world but for the glory of my god and the freedom and welfare of my country . and thus i close mine epistle . alma chapter alma behold now it come to pass that soon after moroni have send his epistle unto the chief governor he receive an epistle from pahoran the chief governor . and these be the word which he receive alma i pahoran who be the chief governor of this land do send these word unto moroni the chief captain over the army . behold i say unto you moroni that i do not joy in your great affliction yea it grieve my soul . alma but behold there be those who do joy in your affliction yea insomuch that they have rise up in rebellion against me and also those of my people who be freeman yea and those who have rise up be exceedingly numerous . alma and it be those who have seek to take away the judgment seat from me that have be the cause of this great iniquity for they have use great flattery and they have lead away the heart of many people which will be the cause of sore affliction among u they have withhold our provision and have daunt our freeman that they have not come unto you . alma and behold they have drive me out before them and i have flee to the land of gideon with a many men a it be possible that i could get . alma and behold i have send a proclamation throughout this part of the land and behold they be flock to u daily to their arm in the defence of their country and their freedom and to avenge our wrong . alma and they have come unto u insomuch that those who have rise up in rebellion against u be set at defiance yea insomuch that they do fear u and durst not come out against u to battle . alma they have get possession of the land or the city of zarahemla they have appoint a king over them and he hath write unto the king of the lamanites in the which he hath join an alliance with him in the which alliance he hath agree to maintain the city of zarahemla which maintenance he supposeth will enable the lamanites to conquer the remainder of the land and he shall be place king over this people when they shall be conquer under the lamanites . alma and now in your epistle you have censure me but it mattereth not i be not angry but do rejoice in the greatness of your heart . i pahoran do not seek for power save only to retain my judgment seat that i may preserve the right and the liberty of my people . my soul standeth fast in that liberty in the which god hath make u free . alma and now behold we will resist wickedness even unto bloodshed . we would not shed the blood of the lamanites if they would stay in their own land . alma we would not shed the blood of our brother if they would not rise up in rebellion and take the sword against u . alma we would subject ourselves to the yoke of bondage if it be requisite with the justice of god or if he should command u so to do . alma but behold he doth not command u that we shall subject ourselves to our enemy but that we should put our trust in him and he will deliver u . alma therefore my beloved brother moroni let u resist evil and whatsoever evil we can not resist with our word yea such a rebellion and dissension let u resist them with our sword that we may retain our freedom that we may rejoice in the great privilege of our church and in the cause of our redeemer and our god . alma therefore come unto me speedily with a few of your men and leave the remainder in the charge of lehi and teancum give unto them power to conduct the war in that part of the land accord to the spirit of god which be also the spirit of freedom which be in them . alma behold i have send a few provision unto them that they may not perish until ye can come unto me . alma gather together whatsoever force ye can upon your march hither and we will go speedily against those dissenter in the strength of our god accord to the faith which be in u . alma and we will take possession of the city of zarahemla that we may obtain more food to send forth unto lehi and teancum yea we will go forth against them in the strength of the lord and we will put an end to this great iniquity . alma and now moroni i do joy in receive your epistle for i be somewhat worried concern what we should do whether it should be just in u to go against our brother . alma but ye have say except they repent the lord hath command you that ye should go against them . alma see that ye strengthen lehi and teancum in the lord tell them to fear not for god will deliver them yea and also all those who stand fast in that liberty wherewith god hath make them free . and now i close mine epistle to my beloved brother moroni . alma chapter alma and now it come to pass that when moroni have receive this epistle his heart do take courage and be fill with exceedingly great joy because of the faithfulness of pahoran that he be not also a traitor to the freedom and cause of his country . alma but he do also mourn exceedingly because of the iniquity of those who have drive pahoran from the judgment seat yea in fine because of those who have rebel against their country and also their god . alma and it come to pass that moroni take a small number of men accord to the desire of pahoran and give lehi and teancum command over the remainder of his army and take his march towards the land of gideon . alma and he do raise the standard of liberty in whatsoever place he do enter and gain whatsoever force he could in all his march towards the land of gideon . alma and it come to pass that thousand do flock unto his standard and do take up their sword in the defence of their freedom that they might not come into bondage . alma and thus when moroni have gather together whatsoever men he could in all his march he come to the land of gideon and unite his force with those of pahoran they become exceedingly strong even strong than the men of pachus who be the king of those dissenter who have drive the freeman out of the land of zarahemla and have take possession of the land . alma and it come to pass that moroni and pahoran go down with their army into the land of zarahemla and go forth against the city and do meet the men of pachus insomuch that they do come to battle . alma and behold pachus be slay and his men be take prisoner and pahoran be restore to his judgment seat . alma and the men of pachus receive their trial accord to the law and also those king men who have be take and cast into prison and they be execute accord to the law yea those men of pachus and those king men whosoever would not take up arm in the defence of their country but would fight against it be put to death . alma and thus it become expedient that this law should be strictly observe for the safety of their country yea and whosoever be find deny their freedom be speedily execute accord to the law . alma and thus end the thirtieth year of the reign of the judge over the people of nephi moroni and pahoran have restore peace to the land of zarahemla among their own people have inflict death upon all those who be not true to the cause of freedom . alma and it come to pass in the commencement of the thirty and first year of the reign of the judge over the people of nephi moroni immediately cause that provision should be send and also an army of six thousand men should be send unto helaman to assist him in preserve that part of the land . alma and he also cause that an army of six thousand men with a sufficient quantity of food should be send to the army of lehi and teancum . and it come to pass that this be do to fortify the land against the lamanites . alma and it come to pass that moroni and pahoran leave a large body of men in the land of zarahemla take their march with a large body of men towards the land of nephihah be determine to overthrow the lamanites in that city . alma and it come to pass that a they be march towards the land they take a large body of men of the lamanites and slew many of them and take their provision and their weapon of war . alma and it come to pass after they have take them they cause them to enter into a covenant that they would no more take up their weapon of war against the nephites . alma and when they have enter into this covenant they send them to dwell with the people of ammon and they be in number about four thousand who have not be slay . alma and it come to pass that when they have send them away they pursue their march towards the land of nephihah . and it come to pass that when they have come to the city of nephihah they do pitch their tent in the plain of nephihah which be near the city of nephihah . alma now moroni be desirous that the lamanites should come out to battle against them upon the plain but the lamanites know of their exceedingly great courage and behold the greatness of their number therefore they durst not come out against them therefore they do not come to battle in that day . alma and when the night come moroni go forth in the darkness of the night and come upon the top of the wall to spy out in what part of the city the lamanites do camp with their army . alma and it come to pass that they be on the east by the entrance and they be all asleep . and now moroni return to his army and cause that they should prepare in haste strong cord and ladder to be let down from the top of the wall into the inner part of the wall . alma and it come to pass that moroni cause that his men should march forth and come upon the top of the wall and let themselves down into that part of the city yea even on the west where the lamanites do not camp with their army . alma and it come to pass that they be all let down into the city by night by the mean of their strong cord and their ladder thus when the morning come they be all within the wall of the city . alma and now when the lamanites awake and saw that the army of moroni be within the wall they be affright exceedingly insomuch that they do flee out by the pas . alma and now when moroni saw that they be flee before him he do cause that his men should march forth against them and slew many and surround many others and take them prisoner and the remainder of them flee into the land of moroni which be in the border by the seashore . alma thus have moroni and pahoran obtain the possession of the city of nephihah without the loss of one soul and there be many of the lamanites who be slain . alma now it come to pass that many of the lamanites that be prisoner be desirous to join the people of ammon and become a free people . alma and it come to pass that as many a be desirous unto them it be grant accord to their desire . alma therefore all the prisoner of the lamanites do join the people of ammon and do begin to labor exceedingly till the ground raise all manner of grain and flock and herd of every kind and thus be the nephites relieve from a great burden yea insomuch that they be relieve from all the prisoner of the lamanites . alma now it come to pass that moroni after he have obtain possession of the city of nephihah have take many prisoner which do reduce the army of the lamanites exceedingly and have regain many of the nephites who have be take prisoner which do strengthen the army of moroni exceedingly therefore moroni go forth from the land of nephihah to the land of lehi . alma and it come to pass that when the lamanites saw that moroni be come against them they be again frighten and flee before the army of moroni . alma and it come to pass that moroni and his army do pursue them from city to city until they be meet by lehi and teancum and the lamanites flee from lehi and teancum even down upon the border by the seashore until they come to the land of moroni . alma and the army of the lamanites be all gather together insomuch that they be all in one body in the land of moroni . now ammoron the king of the lamanites be also with them . alma and it come to pass that moroni and lehi and teancum do encamp with their army round about in the border of the land of moroni insomuch that the lamanites be encircle about in the border by the wilderness on the south and in the border by the wilderness on the east . alma and thus they do encamp for the night . for behold the nephites and the lamanites also be weary because of the greatness of the march therefore they do not resolve upon any stratagem in the night time save it be teancum for he be exceedingly angry with ammoron insomuch that he consider that ammoron and amalickiah his brother have be the cause of this great and lasting war between them and the lamanites which have be the cause of so much war and bloodshed yea and so much famine . alma and it come to pass that teancum in his anger do go forth into the camp of the lamanites and do let himself down over the wall of the city . and he go forth with a cord from place to place insomuch that he do find the king and he do cast a javelin at him which do pierce him near the heart . but behold the king do awaken his servant before he die insomuch that they do pursue teancum and slew him . alma now it come to pass that when lehi and moroni knew that teancum be dead they be exceedingly sorrowful for behold he have be a man who have fight valiantly for his country yea a true friend to liberty and he have suffer very many exceedingly sore affliction . but behold he be dead and have go the way of all the earth . alma now it come to pass that moroni march forth on the morrow and come upon the lamanites insomuch that they do slay them with a great slaughter and they do drive them out of the land and they do flee even that they do not return at that time against the nephites . alma and thus end the thirty and first year of the reign of the judge over the people of nephi and thus they have have war and bloodshed and famine and affliction for the space of many year . alma and there have be murder and contention and dissension and all manner of iniquity among the people of nephi nevertheless for the righteous ' sake yea because of the prayer of the righteous they be spar . alma but behold because of the exceedingly great length of the war between the nephites and the lamanites many have become hardened because of the exceedingly great length of the war and many be soften because of their affliction insomuch that they do humble themselves before god even in the depth of humility . alma and it come to pass that after moroni have fortify those part of the land which be most expose to the lamanites until they be sufficiently strong he return to the city of zarahemla and also helaman return to the place of his inheritance and there be once more peace establish among the people of nephi . alma and moroni yield up the command of his army into the hand of his son whose name be moronihah and he retire to his own house that he might spend the remainder of his day in peace . alma and pahoran do return to his judgment seat and helaman do take upon him again to preach unto the people the word of god for because of so many war and contention it have become expedient that a regulation should be make again in the church . alma therefore helaman and his brother go forth and do declare the word of god with much power unto the convincing of many people of their wickedness which do cause them to repent of their sin and to be baptize unto the lord their god . alma and it come to pass that they do establish again the church of god throughout all the land . alma yea and regulation be make concern the law . and their judge and their chief judge be choose . alma and the people of nephi begin to prosper again in the land and begin to multiply and to wax exceedingly strong again in the land . and they begin to grow exceedingly rich . alma but notwithstanding their rich or their strength or their prosperity they be not lift up in the pride of their eye neither be they slow to remember the lord their god but they do humble themselves exceedingly before him . alma yea they do remember how great thing the lord have do for them that he have deliver them from death and from bond and from prison and from all manner of affliction and he have deliver them out of the hand of their enemy . alma and they do pray unto the lord their god continually insomuch that the lord do bless them accord to his word so that they do wax strong and prosper in the land . alma and it come to pass that all these thing be do . and helaman die in the thirty and fifth year of the reign of the judge over the people of nephi . alma chapter alma and it come to pass in the commencement of the thirty and sixth year of the reign of the judge over the people of nephi that shiblon take possession of those sacred thing which have be deliver unto helaman by alma . alma and he be a just man and he do walk uprightly before god and he do observe to do good continually to keep the commandment of the lord his god and also do his brother . alma and it come to pass that moroni die also . and thus end the thirty and sixth year of the reign of the judge . alma and it come to pass that in the thirty and seventh year of the reign of the judge there be a large company of men even to the amount of five thousand and four hundred men with their wife and their child depart out of the land of zarahemla into the land which be northward . alma and it come to pass that hagoth he be an exceedingly curious man therefore he go forth and build him an exceedingly large ship on the border of the land bountiful by the land desolation and launch it forth into the west sea by the narrow neck which lead into the land northward . alma and behold there be many of the nephites who do enter therein and do sail forth with much provision and also many woman and child and they take their course northward . and thus end the thirty and seventh year . alma and in the thirty and eighth year this man build other ship . and the first ship do also return and many more people do enter into it and they also take much provision and set out again to the land northward . alma and it come to pass that they be never hear of more . and we suppose that they be drown in the depth of the sea . and it come to pass that one other ship also do sail forth and whither she do go we know not . alma and it come to pass that in this year there be many people who go forth into the land northward . and thus end the thirty and eighth year . alma and it come to pass in the thirty and ninth year of the reign of the judge shiblon die also and corianton have go forth to the land northward in a ship to carry forth provision unto the people who have go forth into that land . alma therefore it become expedient for shiblon to confer those sacred thing before his death upon the son of helaman who be call helaman be call after the name of his father . alma now behold all those engraving which be in the possession of helaman be write and send forth among the child of men throughout all the land save it be those part which have be command by alma should not go forth . alma nevertheless these thing be to be keep sacred and hand down from one generation to another therefore in this year they have be confer upon helaman before the death of shiblon . alma and it come to pass also in this year that there be some dissenter who have go forth unto the lamanites and they be stir up again to anger against the nephites . alma and also in this same year they come down with a numerous army to war against the people of moronihah or against the army of moronihah in the which they be beat and drive back again to their own land suffer great loss . alma and thus end the thirty and ninth year of the reign of the judge over the people of nephi . alma and thus end the account of alma and helaman his son and also shiblon who be his son . the book of helaman an account of the nephites . their war and contention and their dissension . and also the prophecy of many holy prophet before the come of christ accord to the record of helaman who be the son of helaman and also accord to the record of his son even down to the come of christ . and also many of the lamanites be convert . an account of their conversion . an account of the righteousness of the lamanites and the wickedness and abomination of the nephites accord to the record of helaman and his son even down to the come of christ which be call the book of helaman . helaman chapter helaman and now behold it come to pass in the commencement of the fortieth year of the reign of the judge over the people of nephi there begin to be a serious difficulty among the people of the nephites . helaman for behold pahoran have die and go the way of all the earth therefore there begin to be a serious contention concern who should have the judgment seat among the brother who be the son of pahoran . helaman now these be their name who do contend for the judgment seat who do also cause the people to contend pahoran paanchi and pacumeni . helaman now these be not all the son of pahoran for he have many but these be they who do contend for the judgment seat therefore they do cause three division among the people . helaman nevertheless it come to pass that pahoran be appoint by the voice of the people to be chief judge and a governor over the people of nephi . helaman and it come to pass that pacumeni when he saw that he could not obtain the judgment seat he do unite with the voice of the people . helaman but behold paanchi and that part of the people that be desirous that he should be their governor be exceedingly wroth therefore he be about to flatter away those people to rise up in rebellion against their brother . helaman and it come to pass a he be about to do this behold he be take and be try accord to the voice of the people and condemn unto death for he have raise up in rebellion and seek to destroy the liberty of the people . helaman now when those people who be desirous that he should be their governor saw that he be condemn unto death therefore they be angry and behold they send forth one kishkumen even to the judgment seat of pahoran and murder pahoran a he sit upon the judgment seat . helaman and he be pursue by the servant of pahoran but behold so speedy be the flight of kishkumen that no man could overtake him . helaman and he go unto those that send him and they all enter into a covenant yea swearing by their everlasting maker that they would tell no man that kishkumen have murder pahoran . helaman therefore kishkumen be not know among the people of nephi for he be in disguise at the time that he murder pahoran . and kishkumen and his band who have covenant with him do mingle themselves among the people in a manner that they all could not be find but as many a be find be condemn unto death . helaman and now behold pacumeni be appoint accord to the voice of the people to be a chief judge and a governor over the people to reign in the stead of his brother pahoran and it be accord to his right . and all this be do in the fortieth year of the reign of the judge and it have an end . helaman and it come to pass in the forty and first year of the reign of the judge that the lamanites have gather together an innumerable army of men and arm them with sword and with cimeters and with bow and with arrow and with head plate and with breastplate and with all manner of shield of every kind . helaman and they come down again that they might pitch battle against the nephites . and they be lead by a man whose name be coriantumr and he be a descendant of zarahemla and he be a dissenter from among the nephites and he be a large and a mighty man . helaman therefore the king of the lamanites whose name be tubaloth who be the son of ammoron suppose that coriantumr be a mighty man could stand against the nephites with his strength and also with his great wisdom insomuch that by send him forth he should gain power over the nephites helaman therefore he do stir them up to anger and he do gather together his army and he do appoint coriantumr to be their leader and do cause that they should march down to the land of zarahemla to battle against the nephites . helaman and it come to pass that because of so much contention and so much difficulty in the government that they have not keep sufficient guard in the land of zarahemla for they have suppose that the lamanites durst not come into the heart of their land to attack that great city zarahemla . helaman but it come to pass that coriantumr do march forth at the head of his numerous host and come upon the inhabitant of the city and their march be with such exceedingly great speed that there be no time for the nephites to gather together their army . helaman therefore coriantumr do cut down the watch by the entrance of the city and do march forth with his whole army into the city and they do slay every one who do oppose them insomuch that they do take possession of the whole city . helaman and it come to pass that pacumeni who be the chief judge do flee before coriantumr even to the wall of the city . and it come to pass that coriantumr do smite him against the wall insomuch that he die . and thus end the day of pacumeni . helaman and now when coriantumr saw that he be in possession of the city of zarahemla and saw that the nephites have flee before them and be slay and be take and be cast into prison and that he have obtain the possession of the strong hold in all the land his heart take courage insomuch that he be about to go forth against all the land . helaman and now he do not tarry in the land of zarahemla but he do march forth with a large army even towards the city of bountiful for it be his determination to go forth and cut his way through with the sword that he might obtain the north part of the land . helaman and suppose that their great strength be in the center of the land therefore he do march forth give them no time to assemble themselves together save it be in small body and in this manner they do fall upon them and cut them down to the earth . helaman but behold this march of coriantumr through the center of the land give moronihah great advantage over them notwithstanding the greatness of the number of the nephites who be slain . helaman for behold moronihah have suppose that the lamanites durst not come into the center of the land but that they would attack the city round about in the border a they have hitherto do therefore moronihah have cause that their strong army should maintain those part round about by the border . helaman but behold the lamanites be not frighten accord to his desire but they have come into the center of the land and have take the capital city which be the city of zarahemla and be march through the most capital part of the land slay the people with a great slaughter both men woman and child take possession of many city and of many stronghold . helaman but when moronihah have discover this he immediately send forth lehi with an army round about to head them before they should come to the land bountiful . helaman and thus he do and he do head them before they come to the land bountiful and give unto them battle insomuch that they begin to retreat back towards the land of zarahemla . helaman and it come to pass that moronihah do head them in their retreat and do give unto them battle insomuch that it become an exceedingly bloody battle yea many be slain and among the number who be slain coriantumr be also find . helaman and now behold the lamanites could not retreat either way neither on the north nor on the south nor on the east nor on the west for they be surround on every hand by the nephites . helaman and thus have coriantumr plunge the lamanites into the midst of the nephites insomuch that they be in the power of the nephites and he himself be slay and the lamanites do yield themselves into the hand of the nephites . helaman and it come to pass that moronihah take possession of the city of zarahemla again and cause that the lamanites who have be take prisoner should depart out of the land in peace . helaman and thus end the forty and first year of the reign of the judge . helaman chapter helaman and it come to pass in the forty and second year of the reign of the judge after moronihah have establish again peace between the nephites and the lamanites behold there be no one to fill the judgment seat therefore there begin to be a contention again among the people concern who should fill the judgment seat . helaman and it come to pass that helaman who be the son of helaman be appoint to fill the judgment seat by the voice of the people . helaman but behold kishkumen who have murder pahoran do lay wait to destroy helaman also and he be uphold by his band who have enter into a covenant that no one should know his wickedness . helaman for there be one gadianton who be exceedingly expert in many word and also in his craft to carry on the secret work of murder and of robbery therefore he become the leader of the band of kishkumen . helaman therefore he do flatter them and also kishkumen that if they would place him in the judgment seat he would grant unto those who belong to his band that they should be place in power and authority among the people therefore kishkumen seek to destroy helaman . helaman and it come to pass a he go forth towards the judgment seat to destroy helaman behold one of the servant of helaman have be out by night and have obtain through disguise a knowledge of those plan which have be lay by this band to destroy helaman helaman and it come to pass that he meet kishkumen and he give unto him a sign therefore kishkumen make know unto him the object of his desire desiring that he would conduct him to the judgment seat that he might murder helaman . helaman and when the servant of helaman have know all the heart of kishkumen and how that it be his object to murder and also that it be the object of all those who belong to his band to murder and to rob and to gain power and this be their secret plan and their combination the servant of helaman say unto kishkumen let u go forth unto the judgment seat . helaman now this do please kishkumen exceedingly for he do suppose that he should accomplish his design but behold the servant of helaman a they be go forth unto the judgment seat do stab kishkumen even to the heart that he fell dead without a groan . and he run and tell helaman all the thing which he have see and hear and do . helaman and it come to pass that helaman do send forth to take this band of robber and secret murderer that they might be execute accord to the law . helaman but behold when gadianton have find that kishkumen do not return he fear l that he should be destroy therefore he cause that his band should follow him . and they take their flight entire destruction of the people of nephi . helaman behold i do not mean the end of the book of helaman but i mean the end of the book of nephi from which i have take all the account which i have write . helaman chapter helaman and now it come to pass in the forty and third year of the reign of the judge there be no contention among the people of nephi save it be a little pride which be in the church which do cause some little dissension among the people which affair be settle in the end of the forty and third year . helaman and there be no contention among the people in the forty and fourth year neither be there much contention in the forty and fifth year . helaman and it come to pass in the forty and sixth yea there be much contention and many dissension in the which there be an exceedingly great many who depart out of the land of zarahemla and go forth unto the land northward to inherit the land . helaman and they do travel to an exceedingly great distance insomuch that they come to large body of water and many river . helaman yea and even they do spread forth into all part of the land into whatever part it have not be render desolate and without timber because of the many inhabitant who have before inherit the land . helaman and now no part of the land be desolate save it be for timber but because of the greatness of the destruction of the people who have before inhabit the land it be call desolate . helaman and there be but little timber upon the face of the land nevertheless the people who go forth become exceedingly expert in the working of cement therefore they do build house of cement in the which they do dwell . helaman and it come to pass that they do multiply and spread and do go forth from the land southward to the land northward and do spread insomuch that they begin to cover the face of the whole earth from the sea south to the sea north from the sea west to the sea east . helaman and the people who be in the land northward do dwell in tent and in house of cement and they do suffer whatsoever tree should spring up upon the face of the land that it should grow up that in time they might have timber to build their house yea their city and their temple and their synagogue and their sanctuary and all manner of their building . helaman and it come to pass a timber be exceedingly scarce in the land northward they do send forth much by the way of shipping . helaman and thus they do enable the people in the land northward that they might build many city both of wood and of cement . helaman and it come to pass that there now this be a great evil which do cause the more humble part of the people to suffer great persecution and to wade through much affliction . helaman nevertheless they do fast and pray oft and do wax the lamanites . helaman and it come to pass in the sixty and first year of the reign of the judge they succeed in regain even the half of all their possession . helaman now this great loss of the concern their iniquity and what should come unto them if they do not repent of their sin . helaman and it come to pass that they do repent and inasmuch a they do repent they do begin to prosper . helaman for when moronihah saw that they do repent he do venture to lead them forth from place to place and from city to city even until they have regain the one half of their property and the one half of all their land . helaman and thus end the sixty and first year of the reign of the judge . helaman and it come to pass in the sixty and second year of the reign of the judge that moronihah could obtain no more possession over the lamanites . helaman therefore they do abandon their design to obtain the remainder of their land for so numerous be the lamanites that it become impossible for the nephites to obtain more power over them therefore moronihah do employ all his army in maintain those part which he have take . helaman and it come to pass because of the greatness of the number of the lamanites the nephites be in great fear l they should be overpower and tread down and slay and destroy . helaman yea they begin to remember the prophecy of alma and also the word of mosiah and they saw that they have be a stiffnecked people and that they have set at naught the commandment of god . helaman and that they have alter and trample under their foot the law of mosiah or that which the lord command him to give unto the people and they saw that their law have become corrupted and that they have become a wicked people insomuch that they be wicked even like unto the lamanites . helaman and because of their iniquity the church have begin to dwindle and they begin to disbelieve in the spirit of prophecy and in the spirit of revelation and the judgment of god do stare them in the face . helaman and they saw that they have become weak like unto their brother the lamanites and that the spirit of the lord do no more preserve them yea it have withdraw from them because the spirit of the lord doth not dwell in unholy temple helaman therefore the lord do cease to preserve them by his miraculous and matchless power for they have fall into a state of unbelief and awful wickedness and they saw that the lamanites be exceedingly more numerous than they and except they should cleave unto the lord their god they must unavoidably perish . helaman for behold they saw that the strength of the lamanites be as great a their strength even man for man . and thus have they fall into this great transgression yea thus have they become weak because of their transgression in the space of not many year . helaman chapter helaman and it come to pass that in this same year behold nephi deliver up the judgment seat to a man whose name be cezoram . helaman for a their law and their government be establish by the voice of the people and they who choose evil be more numerous than they who choose good therefore they be ripen for destruction for the law have become corrupt . helaman yea and this be not all they be a stiffnecked people insomuch that they could not be govern by the law nor justice save it be to their destruction . helaman and it come to pass that nephi have become helaman for they remember the word which their father helaman spake unto them . and these be the word which he spake helaman behold my son i desire that ye should remember to keep the commandment of god and i would that ye should declare unto the people these word . behold i have give unto you the name of our first parent who come out of the land of jerusalem and this i have do that when you remember your name ye may remember them and when ye remember them ye may remember their work and when ye remember their work ye may know how that it be say and also write that they be good . helaman away yea that ye may have that precious gift of eternal life which we have reason to suppose hath be give to our father . helaman o remember remember my son the word which king benjamin spake unto his his brother be cast by the servant of limhi . helaman and after they have be cast into prison many day without food behold they go forth into the prison to take them that they might slay them . helaman and it come to pass that nephi and lehi be encircle about a if by fire even insomuch that they durst not lay their hand upon them for fear l they should be burn . nevertheless nephi and lehi be not burn and they be a stand in the midst of fire and be not burn . helaman and when they saw that they be encircle about with a pillar of fire and that it burn them not their heart do take courage . helaman for they saw that the lamanites durst not lay their hand upon them neither durst they come near unto them but stand a if they be strike dumb with amazement . helaman and it come to pass that nephi and lehi do stand forth and begin to speak unto them say fear not for behold it be god that have show unto you this marvelous thing in the which be show unto you that ye can not lay your hand on u to slay u . helaman and behold when they have say these word the earth shook exceedingly and the wall of the prison do shake a if they be about to tumble to the earth but behold they do not fall . and behold they that be in the prison be lamanites and nephites who be dissenter . helaman and it come to pass that they be overshadow with a cloud of darkness and an awful solemn fear come upon them . helaman and it come to pass that there come a voice a if it be above the cloud of darkness say repent ye repent ye and seek no more to destroy my servant whom i have send unto you to declare good tidings . helaman and it come to pass when they hear this voice and beheld that it be not a voice of thunder neither be it a voice of a great tumultuous noise but behold it be a still voice of perfect mildness a if it have be a whisper and it do pierce even to the very soul helaman and notwithstanding the mildness of the voice behold the earth shook exceedingly and the wall of the prison tremble again a if it be about to tumble to the earth and behold the cloud of darkness which have overshadow them do not disperse helaman and behold the voice come again say repent ye repent ye for the kingdom of heaven be at hand and seek no more to destroy my servant . and it come to pass that the earth shook again and the wall tremble . helaman and also again the third time the voice come and do speak unto them marvelous word which can not be utter by man and the wall do tremble again and the earth shook a if it be about to divide asunder . helaman and it come to pass that the lamanites could not flee because of the cloud of darkness which do overshadow them yea and also they be immovable because of the fear which do come upon them . helaman now there be one among them who be a nephite by birth who have once belong to the church of god but have dissent from them . helaman and it come to pass that he turn him about and behold he saw through the cloud of darkness the face of nephi and lehi and behold they do shine exceedingly even a the face of angel . and he behold that they do lift their eye to heaven and they be in the attitude a if talk or lift their voice to some be whom they behold . helaman and it come to pass that this man do cry unto the multitude that they might turn and look . and behold there be power give unto them that they do turn and look and they do behold the face of nephi and lehi . helaman and they say unto the man behold what do all these thing mean and who be it with whom these men do converse ? helaman now the man 's name be aminadab . and aminadab say unto them they do converse with the angel of god . helaman and it come to pass that the lamanites say unto him what shall we do that this cloud of darkness may be remove from overshadow u ? helaman and aminadab say unto them you must repent and cry unto the voice even until ye shall have faith in christ who be teach unto you by alma and amulek and zeezrom and when ye shall do this the cloud of darkness shall be remove from overshadow you . helaman and it come to pass that they all do begin to cry unto the voice of him who have shake the earth yea they do cry even until the cloud of darkness be disperse . helaman and it come to pass that when they cast their eye about and saw that the cloud of darkness be disperse from overshadow them behold they saw that they be encircle about yea every soul by a pillar of fire . helaman and nephi and lehi be in the midst of them yea they be encircle about yea they be a if in the midst of a flaming fire yet it do harm them not neither do it take hold upon the wall of the prison and they be fill with that joy which be unspeakable and full of glory . helaman and behold the holy spirit of god do come down from heaven and do enter into their heart and they be fill a if with fire and they could speak forth marvelous word . helaman and it come to pass that there come a voice unto them yea a pleasant voice a if it be a whisper say helaman peace peace be unto you because of your faith in my well beloved who be from the foundation of the world . helaman and now when they hear this they cast up their eye a if to behold from whence the voice come and behold they saw the heaven open and angel come down out of heaven and minister unto them . helaman and there be about three hundred soul who saw and hear these thing and they be bid to their weapon of war and also their hatred and the tradition of their father . helaman and it come to pass that they do yield up unto the nephites the land of their possession . helaman chapter helaman and it come to pass that when the sixty and second year of the reign of the judge have end all these thing have happen and the lamanites have become the more part of them a righteous people insomuch that their righteousness do exceed that of the nephites because of their firmness and their steadiness in the faith . helaman for behold there be many of the nephites who have become harden and impenitent and grossly wicked insomuch that they do reject the word of god and all the preaching and prophesy which do come among them . helaman nevertheless the people of the church do have great joy because of the conversion of the lamanites yea because of the church of god which have be establish among them . and they do fellowship one with another and do rejoice one with another and do have them to faith and repentance . helaman yea and many do preach with exceedingly great power and authority unto the bring down many of them into the depth of humility to be the humble follower of god and the lamb . helaman and it come to pass that many of the lamanites do go into the land northward and also nephi and lehi go into the land northward to preach unto the people . and thus end the sixty and third year . helaman and behold there be peace in all the land insomuch that the nephites do go into whatsoever part of the land they would whether among the nephites or the lamanites . helaman and it come to pass that the lamanites do also go whithersoever they would whether it be among the lamanites or among the nephites and thus they do have free intercourse one with another to buy and to sell and to get gain accord to their desire . helaman and it come to pass that they become exceedingly rich both the lamanites and the nephites and they do have an exceed plenty of gold and of silver and of all manner of precious metal both in the land south and in the land north . helaman now the land south be call lehi and the land north be call mulek which be after the son of zedekiah for the lord do bring mulek into the land north and lehi into the land south . helaman and behold there be all manner of gold in both these land and of silver and of precious ore of every kind and there be also curious workman who do work all kind of ore and do refine it and thus they do become rich . helaman they do raise grain in abundance both in the north and in the south and they do flourish exceedingly both in the north and in the south . and they do multiply and wax exceedingly strong in the land . and they do raise many flock and herd yea many fatlings . helaman behold their woman do toil and spin and do make all manner of cloth of fine twin linen and cloth of every kind to clothe their nakedness . and thus the sixty and fourth year do pass away in peace . helaman and in the sixty and fifth year they do also have great joy and peace yea much preaching and many prophecy concern that which be to come . and thus pass away the sixty and fifth year . helaman and it come to pass that in the sixty and sixth year of the reign of the judge behold cezoram be murder by an unknown hand a he sit upon the judgment seat . and it come to pass that in the same year that his son who have be appoint by the people in his stead be also murder . and thus end the sixty and sixth year . helaman and in the commencement of the sixty and seventh year the people begin to grow exceedingly wicked again . helaman for behold the lord have bless them so long with the rich of the world that they have not be stir up to anger to war nor to bloodshed therefore they begin to set their heart upon their rich yea they begin to seek to get gain that they might be lift up one above another therefore they begin to commit secret murder and to rob and to plunder that they might get gain . helaman and now behold those murderer and plunderer be a band who have be form by kishkumen and gadianton . and now it have come to pass that there be many even among the nephites of gadianton 's band . but behold they be more numerous among the more wicked part of the lamanites . and they be call gadianton 's robber and murderer . helaman and it be they who do murder the chief judge cezoram and his son while in the judgment seat and behold they be not find . helaman and now it come to pass that when the lamanites find that there be robber among them they be exceedingly sorrowful and they do use every mean in their power to destroy them off the face of the earth . helaman but behold satan do stir up the heart of the more part of the nephites insomuch that they do unite with those band of robber and do enter into their covenant and their oath that they would protect and preserve one another in whatsoever difficult circumstance they should be place that they should not suffer for their murder and their plundering and their stealing . helaman and it come to pass that they do have their sign yea their secret sign and their secret word and this that they might distinguish a brother who have enter into the covenant that whatsoever wickedness his brother should do he should not be injure by his brother nor by those who do belong to his band who have take this covenant . helaman and thus they might murder and plunder and steal and commit whoredom and all manner of wickedness contrary to the law of their country and also the law of their god . helaman and whosoever of those who belong to their band should reveal unto the world of their wickedness and their abomination should be try not accord to the law of their country but accord to the law of their wickedness which have be give by gadianton and kishkumen . helaman now behold it be these secret oath and covenant which alma command his son should not go forth unto the world l they should be a mean of bring down the people unto destruction . helaman now behold those secret oath and covenant do not come forth unto gadianton from the record which be deliver unto helaman but behold they be put into the heart of gadianton by that same be who do entice our first parent to partake of the forbidden fruit helaman yea that same be who do plot with cain that if he would murder his brother abel it should not be know unto the world . and he do plot with cain and his follower from that time forth . helaman and also it be that same be who put it into the heart of the people to build a tower sufficiently high that they might get to heaven . and it be that same be who lead on the people who come from that tower into this land who spread the work of darkness and abomination over all the face of the land until he drag the people down to an entire destruction and to an everlasting hell . helaman yea it be that same be who put it into the heart of gadianton to still carry on the work of darkness and of secret murder and he have bring it forth from the beginning of man even down to this time . helaman and behold it be he who be the author of all sin . and behold he doth carry on his work of darkness and secret murder and doth hand down their plot and their oath and their covenant and their plan of awful wickedness from generation to generation accord a he can get hold upon the heart of the child of men . helaman and now behold he have get great hold upon the heart of the nephites yea insomuch that they have become exceedingly wicked yea the more part of them have turn out of the way of righteousness and do trample under their foot the commandment of god and do turn unto their own way and do build up unto themselves idol of their gold and their silver . helaman and it come to pass that all these iniquity do come unto them in the space of not many year insomuch that a more part of it have come unto them in the sixty and seventh year of the reign of the judge over the people of nephi . helaman and they do grow in their iniquity in the sixty and eighth year also . helaman and thus we see that the nephites do begin to dwindle in unbelief and grow in wickedness and abomination while the lamanites begin to grow exceedingly in the knowledge of their god yea they do begin to keep his statute and commandment and to walk in truth and uprightness before him . helaman and thus we see that the spirit of the lord begin to withdraw from the nephites because of the wickedness and the hardness of their heart . helaman and thus we see that the lord begin to pour out his spirit upon the lamanites because of their easiness and willingness to believe in his word . helaman and it come to pass that the lamanites do hunt the band of robber of gadianton and they do preach the word of god among the more wicked the more wicked part of them until they have overspread all the land of the nephites and have seduce the more part of the righteous until they have come down to believe in their work and partake of smite and rend and turn their back upon the poor and the meek and the humble follower of god . helaman and thus we see that they be in an awful state and ripen for an everlasting destruction . helaman
